Issues.Title: packaging test updates and updates to packaging tests
Issues.Body:
I took advantage of this unique situation to give myself a clever little title ;)

This PR does a few things:
1. Updates our packaging to create a `Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf.DncEng.Test` package that contains our test infrastructure that compiles against `Microsoft.NETCore.App` instead of `Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App`. This should be a fairly temporary solution until we open source the infrastructure entirely. There will be an internal PR that consumes this, and then once that is done we can update this repo to consume it.
2. Adds a few of the packaging tests that don't have any special test content files and fixes them from the packaging refactor. The rest of the tests will be updated in the internal repo until we have time to go through OSS cleanup on them.

Fixes #1051 
Fixes #1052

Issues.Title: Using different TextFormattingModes with FlowDocument can sometimes use the incorrect mode.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: any
* Windows version: Windows 10 1903
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**

Using `TextOptions.SetTextFormattingMode()` on a `FlowDocument` or `RichTextBox` should use the specified mode when using different modes in the same application. 
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

The actual mode used is somewhat random, and you cannot change it after it is set.
 
 **Expected behavior:**

The mode specified should be used.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

Create/use many FlowDocument (or RichTextBox) objects with different formatting modes. E.g.

``` 
var richText1 = new RichTextBox();
TextOptions.SetTextFormattingMode(richText1, TextFormattingMode.Ideal);
var richText2 = new RichTextBox();
TextOptions.SetTextFormattingMode(richText2, TextFormattingMode.Display);
```

I have tracked this down to a bug in [`PtsCache.AcquireContextCore`](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/8c7ab1592b6c70e732106aeabf58f215d4b71c22/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationFramework/MS/Internal/PtsHost/PtsCache.cs#L181), where it does not take the desired textFormattingMode into account when looking up an existing context to use from the cache.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Using different TextFormattingModes with FlowDocument can sometimes use the incorrect mode." (#1101)

Issues.Title: Adding reference to assembly System.Web.Extensions causes build error
Issues.Body:
dotnet -- info dotnet\packs\Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref\3.0.0-preview6-27804-01\ref\netcoreapp3.0\System.Web.dll
* Windows version: (1809 build 17763.557)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No
 **Problem description:**
Create a Core 3 App and add a reference to System.Web.Extensions then try to build. The following error is reported:
 1>C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview6-012264\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop\targets\Microsoft.WinFX.targets(243,9): error MC1000: Unknown build error, 'Could not find type 'System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute' in assembly 'C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet\packs\Microsoft.NETCore.App.Ref\3.0.0-preview6-27804-01\ref\netcoreapp3.0\System.Web.dll'.'
 **Expected behavior:**
 Reference should be rejected or it should build as expected.
The target API is System.Web.Extensions.JavaScriptSerializer()
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Adding reference to assembly System.Web.Extensions causes build error" (#1088)

Issues.Title: Data trigger expressions / Inline converters
Issues.Body:
It was always very annoying to create `IValueConverter` for everything. My proposal is to create a new type of trigger or extend DataTrigger so it could support expressions.

There's already a project for that but seems dead: https://github.com/JohannesMoersch/QuickConverter

It compiles expressions at runtime while built-in feature could do it at compile time. Having intellisense for that would be sweet but not necessary.

Every major JS framework support that, see how easy it is in Vue.js for example: https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/conditional.html

That would be a breath of fresh air.

---

There are still many other things that I hate about XAML/WPF like each XAML file is bloated with long namespaces like `xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"`. It would be great if it was implicit and not needed at all. Also, 2006 in the path makes you feel like you're using some outdated technology from 2006. IMHO XAML files should be as clean as possible.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Data trigger expressions / Inline converters" (#1083)
